data.title: Audio.Microphone class missing...
data.body:
After a quick poll on twitter, it seems a few people would like to use this class, which we don't have yet.
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.audio.microphone.default(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx

Just logging it here so we know it may be needed.

data.title: Fixed resolution change on Windows 8
data.body: Simple fix here: Apply changes before sending event, so values will be correct.

data.title: BasicEffect ctor throws InvalidCastException line 383
data.body: Line 383 of BasicEffect on PSM throws InvalidCastException. The 'data' in EffectParameter for the specular power is not an array, but a single float value, so the ((float[])Data)[0]=foo assignment throws an exception.

data.title: "MGFX effect is the wrong profile for this platform" on Windows SM3/DX9
data.body:
I'm trying to use an SM3 shader on a Windows project.  When I attempt to load the shader file, I get the following exception:

"The MGFX effect is the wrong profile for this platform!"

MonoGamePlatform is set to Windows in the relevant locations.

data.title: CLS Compliance
data.body:
Adding the CLSCompliant attribute allows for easier use of the assembly with all .NET languages.
CLSCompliant(true) attribute added to assembly.
CLSCompliant(false) added to fields, properties and methods that are not CLS compliant.
LzxDecoder class is no longer public.

Built with Windows, WindowsGL, Windows8, WindowsPhone and Linux.

data.title: Adding Transform ( Vector[] sourceArray, ref Quaternion rotation, Vector...
data.body:
Adding Vector3.Transform ( Vector[] sourceArray, ref Quaternion rotation, Vector[] destination) to Vector3 class, implemented similarly as compared to the ref Matrix rotation version.

It's basically just a loop added around the same code that is in the singular transform version of it right above.  Specifically Henge3D physics used this XNA function in their engine. So I added it so that it could compile against monogame.

data.title: [Win8] Protocol to reactivate suspended game
data.body: The protocol can be used to reactivate a suspended game, therefore we should only create the game object if it does not already exist.

data.title: Using Premake
data.body:
One problem that has concerned me was the amount of project files we need to maintain to support as many platforms as MonoGame currently does.  With the addition of new platforms and the desire to split MonoGame into multiple assemblies...  project file management will only get worse.

One solution is to switch to using automatic generation of solution/project files using a build configuration tool.  One of these is called [Premake](http://industriousone.com/premake).

> Describe your software project just once, using Premake's simple 
> and easy to read syntax, and build it everywhere. 

Premake is a single EXE with zero dependencies and runs on Windows/Mac/Linux.  

We would write a premake script that defines what solutions/projects to build and what files are included in them.  We then include a small batch file in the project root that would execute that script whenever we need to regenerate things.

The big benefit it consistency and no longer needing to hand edit 10+ project files when something changes.

data.title: Made stencil work on iOS
data.body:
Stencil doesn't work on iOS when rendering directly to screen because its framebuffer is created with no consideration of PreferredDepthStencilFormat.
A better fix would be to consider that, but I didn't want to start digging in the code, and since the depth buffer is already hard coded, I just added that there.

data.title: Visual C# 2010 does not copy SDL.dll
data.body:
Whenever I create a new MonoGame Windows OpenGL Project, and then try to run it in debug mode, I get the following error :

Error   1   Unable to copy file "C:\Users\Program Files (x86)\MonoGame\v3.0\Assemblies\WindowsGL\SDL.dll" to "bin\WindowsGL\Debug\SDL.dll". Could not find a part of the path 'C:\Users\Program Files (x86)\MonoGame\v3.0\Assemblies\WindowsGL\SDL.dll'.    GameName1

So I have to delete the SDL.dll file from the Solution Explorer and then manually add it, every time I create a new project.

How can I make it so it does this automatically?

data.title: EnvironmentMapEffect renders a black model
data.body: Tested in WinRT with XNA4.0 as a sanity check. The EnvironmentMapEffect renders the environment map in XNA just fine, but in MonoGame, the model ends up being just black, no matter how the effect parameters are tweaked.

data.title: GameTime is not keeping track of time
data.body:
I discovered this by putting in a breakpoint on the Update and Draw methods of my game class. No matter how long I sat there waiting, say for 10 seconds and then hit continue, the ElapsedGameTime property was always the same.

For the Update method, the ElapsedGameTime property always has a value of 00:00:00.0166666
For the Draw method, the ElapsedGameTime property always has a value of 00:00:00.4999980

Windows 7 64-bit
MonoGame 3.0.1.0

data.title: Linux and sprite fonts
data.body: I see there is a lot of work on content pipeline, but I'm not able to find anywhere if Monogame on Linux is ready to process .spritefont files, if it is, how should I proceed? I've tried compiling MGCB with the Linux solution, but the executable can't build spritefont files. Is this feature implemented?

data.title: Remove File extension check that only causes failure.
data.body:
If you have a file named something like "button.down.png" and try load it with `content.Load<Texture2D>("button.down")` then we fail to load it as we detect it has an extension in the file name.

This check appears to be unnecessary as there is a check for the file existing a few lines above, also it differs from XNA behaviour, where files named like this work fine.

data.title: Fix ReflectiveReader loading issue
data.body: Minor bugfix to ReflectiveReader

data.title: WinForms And MonoGame
data.body:
Hello all!

This is not an "issue" per se. I read somewhere a while ago that MonoGame was going to have added support for WinForms eventually. I am just checking to see what progress has been made thus far. I am working on a little game project and I want to create child forms/elements for my game window. I've seen tutorials on getting WinForms and XNA working together but they're all hacky/outdated. 

Any input/suggestions/help is greatly appreciated.

data.title: Spritefont rendering is smudged on iOS
data.body:
1. Created a new Arial Regular 20 Spritefont using VS 2010 and latest MonoGame Content template. 
2. Set to MonoGame Spritefont and built for iOS.
3. Create a new Hello World project in Xamarin Studio.
4. Added the Arial20.xnb spritefont to the Content folder.
5. Changed build action to Content and Copy to output directory.
6. Set the backbuffer to white and draw a Hello World string in black.
7. Run in simulator and the output is smudged.
8. See image attached.

![screen shot 2013-05-04 at 16 36 02](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4031207/462664/58dc5016-b4d0-11e2-8930-71c0d96d42fe.png)

Is this a known issue or am I doing something wrong?
Thanks

data.title: Incorrect mouse position in Windows Store project
Initial check in of the Split "Core" PCL solution for the Windows Project
data.body:
Created new MonoGame.Framework PCL library - assembly name MonoGame.Framework
Updated Windows solution to reference new "Core" project and excluded all types managed by "Core" project
Updated Windows Project assembly name to MonoGame.Framework.Platform
Removed unnessasary usings from Shader/ShaderStage.cs (only change)
Updated Content/ContentTypeReaderManager.cs to allow resolution of types from the "Core" Project

No other files have been changed or updated as part of this initial PR
Fully tested against a windows project

data.title: WinDX Support For Left/Right Control, Shift, and Alt Keys
data.body:
We had to switch over to using WK_KEYUP/DOWN events to properly capture the control, shift, and alt keys.

I'm unsure about suppressing the system menu here, but it does allow the alt key to be captured.

UPDATED:

This now uses RawInput to capture keyboard events.  Also I tested XNA4 on the desktop.... it also suppresses the system menu.

data.title: Test of the Build System DO NOT MERGE
Updated default build with PSM support
Path to the split "Core" Project
data.body:
Now that the [DataContract] merge has been completed, just wanted to check on the Core teams feelings about the split "Core" project.

Aim is to separate all the classes that have no #if statements and are completely compatible  with all platforms into a single sharable library (aiming for a PCL project so it is also one project file)

This will be a cross platform clean up task and so help to have clear boundaries between shared code and platform code.

Planning at this stage to tackle one solution at a time starting with the Windows solution.

Alternative is to do all projects at once so it can be completed within one merge, I've already completed many tests against almost all the platforms and PCL libraries have been found to work for all of them with no performance impact.

In either case the folder structure should NOT change, there will simply be one new .csproj pcl for the Core classes and each platform .csproj will be updated to reference the core project and have the shared classes removed from them (just tidy up no changes)

Thoughts?

data.title: Shader upgrade issues from XNA4.0 -> Windows 8
data.body:
In the course of building the Windows 8 version of the Ship game sample I've hit some issues upgrading the shaders to DX 11 (shader noob fyi)

I followed most the advice out there to change types and functions and the shaders now compile but now they are hitting a "not implemented" exception in the GraphicsDevice class (ln 1762), so wondering if there is anything I can do to avoid hitting that.

Another very odd thing in the conversion, in the Blur.fx file - https://github.com/DDReaper/MonoGame-Samples/blob/samples.ShipGame/ShipGameSample/ShipGameContentContent/shaders/Blur.fx - I was able to convert the texture sampling function to DX 11 format:
# if SM4

```
        float4 c = g_ColorMap.Sample(ColorSampler, tc);
```
# else

```
        float4 c = tex2D(ColorSampler, tc);
```
# endif

However if I tried that in any of the other shaders I get the following error:
Error   1   Unable to compile the effect.
X3013: 'Sample': intrinsic method does not take 2 parameters    C:\Development\MonoGame\MonoGame-Darkside\Samples\ShipGameSample\ShipGameContentContent\shaders\AnimSprite.fx   39  33  ShipGameContent

So don't know if this is related to the issue above as I have had to leave those shaders using the old tex2D method

Just odd it works in one shader but not the others?

data.title: Error: Unable to load DLL 'libmojoshader.dll': The specified module could not be found.
data.body:
Getting the above error when trying to compile a content project in a "Windows" build against the new Ship game sample i'm putting together:
https://github.com/DDReaper/MonoGame-Samples/tree/samples.ShipGame/ShipGameSample

No idea what's causing it, the dll in question is attached to the content builder project (not referenced but that's how it came out of the box) and is not blocked on my dev machine.

The full error description I get is:
Error   1   Unable to load DLL 'libmojoshader.dll': The specified module could not be found. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x8007007E)   C:\Development\MonoGame\MonoGame-Darkside\Samples\ShipGameSample\ShipGameContentContent\shaders\Blur.fx ShipGameContent

Link to Blur.fx
https://github.com/DDReaper/MonoGame-Samples/blob/samples.ShipGame/ShipGameSample/ShipGameContentContent/shaders/Blur.fx

data.title: Fix Win8 Build
data.body: This fixes a syntax error in the Windows 8 build...  I don't know how this got past the build bot.

data.title: Windows 8 build not compiling - SharpDXHelper.ToSwapEffect requires PresentInterval NOT PresentParameters
data.body:
Noticed in testing a new sample that the Windows 8 build no longer compiles

This is due to a change in the SharpDXHelper.ToSwapEffect() method, it used to require the full PresentParams buthas been change to only require the PresentInterval vale of PresentParams

This wasn't updated in the GraphicsDevice.cs file at line 745

data.title: Fixes for Mouse class
data.body: This should clarify this class for XNA users. Methods such GetCursorPos are not good for this class in my opinion(probably need an extension)(I did not delete them just hide through internal modifier). And WindowHandle now will return window handle on future WindowsDirectX platform. Also added missing compatibility property set accessor in WindowHandle and normalizing code a bit.
